intro: Uropetalon serotinum var. fulvum, commonly known as the golden sandmat, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and hairy, succulent stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often with a reddish tinge. It thrives in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low rainfall. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
